TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1922: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1928), 3 vols., Vol 2, pp. 537
TEI.2.document_title: H H League to Stephen F Austin, 11-13-1830

barker_notes.barker_summary: H. H. League to Austin, November 13, 1830. Asking Austin's intervention in behalf of Mrs. League.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 537

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*H. H. League to Austin, November 13, 1830. Asking Austin's intervention in behalf of Mrs. League.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**person_mentioned*Col. Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Dear Sir my *person_mentioned*wife */person_mentioned*will start *date_mentioned n="11-12-1830">tomorrow morning*/date_mentioned* to remove to *location_mentioned*Jennings Camp*/location_mentioned* it is unnecessary for me to attempt a description of her deplorable situation and feelings, or my own I have not sufficient use of my faculties to address you as I would wish, but I call upon your humanity and merciful feelings to come down and see and have an interview with*person_mentioned* Mrs League */person_mentioned*before she starts and also with myself*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*H H League*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**date_mentioned n="11-13-1830">Nov—13th—1830*/date_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
